benefits.title: The role of edible mushrooms in health: Evaluation of the evidence
benefits.summary: Mushrooms and their extracts have immunomodulating and anti-tumor effects, primarily due to their polysaccharide content, which enhances cellular immunity.

benefits.title: Anti-inflammatory properties of edible mushrooms: A review.
benefits.summary: Edible mushrooms exhibit favorable therapeutic and health-promoting benefits, particularly in relation to diseases associated with inflammation.

benefits.title: Mini-review on edible mushrooms as source of dietary fiber: Preparation and health benefits
benefits.summary: Edible mushrooms are a novel source of dietary fiber, potentially boosting the immune system, anticancer functions, and controlling blood lipids and glucose levels.

benefits.title: A Critical Review on Health Promoting Benefits of Edible Mushrooms through Gut Microbiota
benefits.summary: Mushrooms possess anti-allergic, anti-cholesterol, anti-tumor, and anti-cancer properties, and act as prebiotics to stimulate the growth of gut microbiota, conferring health benefits to the host.

benefits.title: Mushrooms and Health Summit proceedings.
benefits.summary: Mushrooms may impact cognition, weight management, oral health, and cancer risk, and may support healthy immune and inflammatory responses.

benefits.title: Bioactivities and Health Benefits of Mushrooms Mainly from China
benefits.summary: Mushrooms possess various bioactivities, such as antioxidant, anti-inflammatory, anticancer, immunomodulatory, antimicrobial, hepatoprotective, and antidiabetic properties, which can help prevent and treat chronic diseases.

benefits.title: A critical review on the health promoting effects of mushrooms nutraceuticals
benefits.summary: Mushrooms have high nutritional values and can protect and cure various health problems, such as immunodeficiency, cancer, inflammation, hypertension, hyperlipidemia, hypercholesterolemia, and obesity.

benefits.title: The beneficial role of edible mushrooms in human health
benefits.summary: Consumption of mushrooms as a part of daily diet could be a natural adjuvant for the treatment and prevention of several chronic diseases.

benefits.title: Medicinal Mushrooms: Bioactive Compounds, Use, and Clinical Trials
benefits.summary: Medicinal mushrooms have health benefits such as antiallergic, antibacterial, antifungal, anti-inflammatory, antioxidative, antiviral, cytotoxic, immunomodulating, antidepressive, antihyperlipidemic, antidiabetic, digestive, hepatoprotective, neuroprotective,

benefits.title: Bioactive components of mushrooms: Processing effects and health benefits.
benefits.summary: Mushrooms provide essential proteins, dietary non-digestible carbohydrates, unsaturated fats, minerals, and various vitamins, and are a crucial ingredient in traditional medicine for their healing potential and curative properties.

side effects.title: Flagellate dermatitis after consumption of Shiitake mushrooms
side effects.summary: Consumption of Shiitake mushrooms can cause flagellate dermatitis, a severe itching skin condition.
side effects.journal: Advances in Dermatology and Allergology/Postȩpy Dermatologii i Alergologii

side effects.title: Extreme hyperphosphataemia causing acute anuric nephrocalcinosis in lymphosarcoma.
side effects.summary: Possible long-term side effects of psilocybin mushrooms include flashback phenomenon and severe anxiety symptoms.

side effects.title: Severe rhabdomyolysis, acute renal failure and posterior encephalopathy after 'magic mushroom' abuse.
side effects.summary: Severe rhabdomyolysis, acute renal failure, and posterior encephalopathy can occur after'magic mushroom' abuse.
side effects.journal: European journal of emergency medicine : official journal of the European Society for Emergency Medicine

side effects.title: World of Medicinal Mushroom-An Overview
side effects.summary: Some medicinal mushrooms can cause side effects such as dermatitis and allergic reactions, so caution is advised when consuming them.
side effects.journal: Research Journal of Pharmacognosy and Phytochemistry

side effects.title: Effects of UV-C treatment on inactivation of Escherichia coli O157:H7, microbial loads, and quality of button mushrooms
side effects.summary: UV-C radiation can potentially sanitize fresh button mushrooms and extend their shelf-life, but may cause more severe browning and inhibit lesion development on the mushroom surface.

side effects.title: Structure-toxicity relationships in the amatoxin series. Synthesis of S-deoxy[gamma(R)-hydroxy-Ile3]-amaninamide, its crystal and molecular structure and inhibitory efficiency.
side effects.summary: The amatoxins, highly toxic components of Amanita mushrooms, strongly inhibit the DNA-dependent RNA polymerase II in eukaryotic cell nuclei.
side effects.journal: International journal of peptide and protein research

side effects.title: The Role of Medicinal Mushrooms in Brain Cancer Therapies: Review.
side effects.summary: Medicinal mushrooms reduce side effects in patients undergoing chemotherapy or radiotherapy, and have beneficial effects on high-grade glioma patients.

side effects.title: The potential applications of mushrooms against some facets of atherosclerosis: A review.
side effects.summary: Mushrooms have potential anti-atherosclerotic effects, exhibiting anti-oxidative, anti-inflammatory, and hypolipidemic effects.

side effects.title: The effects of dietary supplementation with Agaricales mushrooms and other medicinal fungi on breast cancer: Evidence-based medicine
side effects.summary: Mushrooms show promising results in the adjuvant treatment of breast cancer, improving immunological and hematologic parameters and quality of life.

dosage.title: Effect of Spent Mushroom (Cordyceps militaris) on Growth Performance, Immunity, and Intestinal Microflora in Weaning Pigs
dosage.summary: Spent mushroom at 1.5 g/kg improved growth performance, immunity, inflammation, and microbial count in weaning pigs.
dosage.journal: Animals : an Open Access Journal from MDPI

dosage.title: A High-Dose Shiitake Mushroom Increases Hepatic Accumulation of Triacylglycerol in Rats Fed a High-Fat Diet: Underlying Mechanism
dosage.summary: High-dose Shiitake mushroom (HD-M) prevents obesity by increasing TAG accumulation in the liver, rather than adipose tissue.

dosage.title: Synthesis and Characterization of Konjac Glucomannan/Carrageenan/Nano-silica Films for the Preservation of Postharvest White Mushrooms
dosage.summary: The optimal nano-silica dosage for preserving white mushrooms is 0.3%.

dosage.title: Failure of the cultivated mushroom (Agaricus bisporus) to induce tumors in the A/J mouse lung tumor model.
dosage.summary: Freeze-dried mushrooms in doses of 92 or 166 mg/kg body weight per day did not induce lung adenomas in female A/J mice.

dosage.title: Evaluation of the safe use and dietary risk of beta-cypermethrin, pyriproxyfen, avermectin, diflubenzuron and chlorothalonil in button mushroom
dosage.summary: The final residues of beta-cypermethrin, pyriproxyfen, avermectin, diflubenzuron, and chlorothalonil in button mushrooms were safe for human consumption after 2 times of application at dosages of 900, 750, 540, 56

dosage.title: Yield and Quality of Mushrooms from Beds Treated with Lindane
dosage.summary: Dosages of 0.5 pound per acre or less did not affect mushroom yield, while 1 pound or more tended to depress yield.

dosage.title: Effect of Mushrooms Compound on Diabetic Mice
dosage.summary: Mushroom compound extract at a dosage of 250mgkg-1d-1 significantly reduces fasting blood glucose, improves glucose tolerance, and reduces total cholesterol, triglyceride, and MDA.
dosage.journal: Journal of Hubei University of Chinese Medicine

dosage.title: Treatment of mushroom poisoning.
dosage.summary: The standard dosage of intravenous thioctic acid for mushroom poisoning is 50 to 150 mg every six hours.

dosage.title: Treatment of Mushroom Poisoning
dosage.summary: Hanrahan and Gordon recommend high doses of pyridoxine hydrochloride (25 mg/kg, up to a total daily dosage of 15 to 20 g) for neurological symptoms of mushroom poisoning.

dosage.title: Biosorption of Cr(VI) from simulated wastewater using a cationic surfactant modified spent mushroom
dosage.summary: The adsorption capacity of a cationic surfactant modified spent mushroom for Cr(VI) removal from wastewater was up to 43.86 mg/g at 25°C.
